page.title: 03Big Houses in Horsmonden
page.content: There are several big houses in Horsmonden. Broadford is an old manor once belonging to the Austen family on the Goudhurst Road about a mile from the village. Sprivers is a manor on the western side of the village which originally belonged to Robert Sprivers who died in l447. It is now in the hands of the National Trust with beautiful grounds which people visit. Shirrenden, another big house quite near Sprivers, has not got so much land. Grovehurst is a Tudor manor on the eastern side of Horsmonden which belonged to the Grovehurst family. Spelmonden by the southern boundary was once owned by John de Spelmonden but then was passed on to Rev. Marriott. Hale Farm House, Plovers and Marle Place are all very large, historical buildings lying near each other to the South-West of the village.
